subject: RE: [junit] JUnit fossilized at 3.8.1?
msgSnippet: ... Nor does anybody else.  Except for a short sentence pronounced by Kent in an interview two months ago, there is absolutely nothing tangible about a
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of J. B. Rainsberger

> JUnit 4.0, complete with support for Java annotations, is in
> the works, but I don't know any more than that.

Nor does anybody else. Except for a short sentence pronounced by Kent in an
interview two months ago, there is absolutely nothing tangible about a
hypothetical JUnit4.

If/when it happens, I certainly hope the process will be very open and users
will be asked for feedback before any kind of work begins.

--
CÃ©dric
